title: YouTubers John and Hank Green pledge $6.5 million to women of Sierra Leone
text:
YouTubers John and Hank Green have pledged $6.5 million (£5 million) to the women of Sierra Leone through Partners In Health.

Speaking about the donation, which will be contributed over five years, John explained that the brothers are addressing the maternal mortality crisis in the country.

He mentioned that one in 17 women die in childbirth or pregnancy in the country due to insufficient hospitals and healthcare.

‘3000 women in Sierra Leone will die in pregnancy and childbirth this year,’ John explained.

John shared shots from his trip to Sierra Leone (Picture: YouTube/Vlogbrothers)

‘They will die of hemorrhaging that any well-stocked hospital could easily address, they die because there is no electricity to keep the lights on during night-time deliveries or to keep blood for transfusions refrigerated.

‘Or they die because there’s no running water which makes it difficult to sanitise tools and prevent infection.’

Partners In Health are aiming to ‘strengthen every facet of the healthcare system’, including hiring more healthcare workers, strengthening primary care centres, and building a huge maternal center at the hospital.

At the time of writing, John and Hank have raised more than $100,000 (£77,000) with donations being matched at every $20,000 (£15,000) milestone.

‘We’re helping Partners In Health launch an initiative that will dramatically improve maternal health care in Sierra Leone, the country with the highest maternal mortality rate in the world,’ they wrote.

John and Hank rose to fame on YouTube (Picture: Getty Images)

‘Then we’re staying to keep that work going as an enduring, systemic solution.

‘We’ve learned that isolated investments often lead to isolated results, but true partnerships can create lasting change. That’s why we are committing to this project for the long term.’

The brothers, who have a following of more than three million on their joint channel, also created the annual Project For Awesome, a 2-day long fundraiser which splits money across charities voted for by viewers.

In 2018, the Project For Awesome raised more than $1.6 million (£1.2 million).

The pair are YouTube OGs, starting their channel in 2007, with John also being renowned for his books including The Fault In Our Stars and Looking For Alaska.
